page.title: 05S.Tanton Farm near Gt.Ayton
page.content: South Tanton Farm is on the banks of the stream called the River Tame. It belongs to the Fletcher family, though three other people help Mr. Fletcher run the farm, which is 250 acres.They have 207 Freisian cows and two horses as well as seven tractors,three ploughs, three power harrows, three sub-soilers and one combine harvester. There is also a boiler, corn dryer, barley mill, roller, and a sprayer and fertiliser. They have one dog and four cats. The cattle are fed on grass potatoes and barley. Most of the cultivated area is under barley, where small fields have been combined to make large ones.The presently fashionable crop of oilseed rape is in one field. The farm house is an 18th century listed building, but most of the barns are much newer.
